meanings.definition: To curse or speak evil of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She maledicts her noisy neighbors every night.
meanings.sent2: He maledicts his bad luck whenever something goes wrong.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man maledicts the squirrels for stealing his nuts.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seem to maledict the peaceful town below.
meanings.sent5: The witch's maledicts were said to bring misfortune to those who crossed her path.

meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll contained powerful maledicts against enemies.
meanings.sent2: She believed that the maledicts of her enemies would never harm her.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the maledicts of Monday mornings.
meanings.sent4: The shadow seemed to carry a silent maledict wherever it went.
meanings.sent5: The old book whispered ancient maledicts to those who dared to read its pages.
